reviewText: I remembered this movie being better than it was.  I used to really like it when I was young, but after watching it again, now think it's lacking.  Top Gun with helicopters, but not as cool.  Tommy Lee Jones is still good in this picture.  I like the sneekiness of the helicopters and the ability to hide and hover - can't really hide too well in fighter jets.
summary: A good watch once movie... maybe a watch twice movie.

reviewText: Top Gun meets Airwolf IS Firebirds. The emphasis in Firebirds is on military helicopters like Cobras, Apaches, and Coyotes although on the movie they are called Scorpions(good band!). Excellent aerial filming with exciting "dogfights"(aerial fights) make this movie a must-have for Top Gun, Blue Thunder, and Airwolf fans. Highly recommended!

reviewText: I bought this DVD as a gift for my mom for Christmas. I was so excited when I gave it to her. It was one of those movies that seemed to be out of print because we had one heck of a time trying to find it to buy at the local DVD outlet stores. Amazon.com was the last place to turn to. The DVD arrived at our house undamaged and it played flawless. We had fun watching it on Christmas night. For those of you that have not seen this movie yet, I highly recommend it. But don't get confused thinking that this movie is based of of Igor Stravinsky's ballet "The Fire Bird" like I did. Great movie for the whole family.!!!!!!!!!!!! I also recommend, "Iron Eagle", "Top Gun", and "The Rocketeer".Update for 3/13/2014 I also bought 2 more copies of this DVD to give as gifts. One for one of my co-workers who is a big fan of "Top Gun", and one for my mom's best friend!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Peter Smith
summary: A Christmas gift for my mom!!!!!!!!!!!

reviewText: I had this as a pre-recorded on VHS but my VCR died a few years ago and never could find a replacement. Then the tape stated to dry up and crumbled and flaked off the tape. Tried to find it on DVD at stores but they stopped carrying it. So I used my old stand-by and checked on Amazon and found it at a reasonable price. Now I can enjoy my movie again whenever I wanted.For a "Used" DVD it never skips or freezes, no scratches and case only has the normal wear.
summary: Been Wanting This On DVD For A Long Time

reviewText: first off, i am truly shocked at the positive reviews this movies is getting. Its ridiculous. One would normally expect a fair plot and decent acting from some credible actors of the likes of Nic Cage and Tommy Lee Jones. They must have been pretty desperate at that time cos this movie stinks bad! The so called story deals with attacking drug cartels in 'south america'! i find this hilarious the way they refer to 'South America' in context almost as a country , which could mean anywhere from Venezuela to Argentina.If the acting and story wasn't bad enough, the way they depicted Apaches in this film is even worse. This is definitely one for the dustbin.A very generous zero stars.
summary: Calling this a terrible B-grade movie is a compliment.

reviewText: FIRE BIRDS (1990) Directed by David Green.Starring Nicholas Cage, Sean Young, Marshall Teague(of BABYLON 5 fame) and Tommy Lee Jones.Set in 1989 in the wake of President George Bush Srs declaration of the war on the South American drug cartels, the film tells of the formation of an Apache helicopter squadron, its training and initiation into combat against the formidable Cuban supplied air power of the Cartels--particularly a deadly Scorpion helicopter pilot trained in North Korea.Something of a helicopter version of TOP GUN except that this film is actually about something important---the war against the Cartels. There are also interesting subplots about women in the military and a former helicopter ace dealing with the fact that he is now 44 and therefore an old man.The film suffers from some unfortunate 80s style hip/macho dialogue and Cages helicopter ace character is inconsistent going from serious and driven to arrogant and irritating with little justification. One suspects he was pressured to act like Cruise in TOP GUN and ends up too often looking like a jerk rather than the American hero he is. One does not understand just why Phil Collins songs seem to be in every damn 80s film ever made but here we are again and it is brutal. Sean Young is very fetching and gives a good intriguing performance as a woman who wants to fly for her country rather than stay at home and be a wife. She is, however, stuck with the films worst line when, about to blow up a bad guy, says Snort this. Jones is very good both as the tough as nails trainer of fighting men and as a man confronting his age. The helicopter sequences are very good in showing what they can do and in the effective way the film explains all the technical information both about the helicopters and some of the problems the men face in learning to fly these complex fighting machines.The film is hardly groundbreaking. The cliches fly as thick as the ordinance. They were making pictures like this in the 1940s with such things as BOMBARDIER or GUNG HO but these films will always be valuable and noble both in creating historical records of the American military at certain moments in history and as a tribute to the men(and now women) who heroically put themselves in harms way for freedom and democracy.Not a masterpiece. Not a bad either. Just an enlightening, ennobling and entertaining little flag waver of the type Hollywood seems unwilling to make any more.
Title: N/A

reviewText: For me, this is a favorite movie of mine. It's your typical air combat movie plot....scenario intro creates plot....training session...final combat....but is very enjoyable. It was filmed before the Apache helicopter was upgraded to the Longbow version (with the radar dome).Most hated this movie but for aviation and helicopter fans its a good movie.  Also was released under the title "Apache: Wings of Gold" but Fire Birds is a more fitting title.
